column4: Can someone help me? The ubuntu installer and GParted both cannot see the partitions on my drive. They both show a large, unallocated drive.
d_smith: Nautilus (the file manager) sees them, and fdisk sees them
did you try gparted from a live cd?
This is a live cd
I am trying to install ubuntu
and the unalocated space is the full disk-space?
Yes. But there should be no unallocated space
I'm not sure, but maybe your MBR or partition table is broken?
I already tried using TestDisk to fix it, and it seems like nothing is wrong
weird, did you try booting from other live cd's? same problem?
No I haven't. But I need this one working so I can install ubuntu
http://img401.imageshack.us/img401/1192/issueff5.png
well yes, but maybe you can prepare a partition with a gparted live cd & then reboot from your ubuntu install cd & see if it can find your partitions that way.
Partitions are ready. Just need to format and install. This is actually a reinstall attempt at ubuntu
then there's something wrong with your partitions. repartitioning might help ;( or some tools to fix it (?)
i am not starting from scratch
then search for tools to check and fix your master boot record / partition table
I already tried one of them, called "TestDisk"
maybe even windows checkdisk and related harddrive things
chkdsk in windows never does anything
you mean you tried it?
Yes, I did
i know Ultimate  Boot CD has some tools to check & fix mbr and partition tables, you could try that
another option might be tools offered by the manufacturerer of the harddrive
